comment: Fantastic. Tough class but she wants you to learn, so she teaches you with plenty of examples. She is leaving KSU - she is definitely an asset to any school.

Best accounting professor I've had at KSU. She made me LIKE tax! Extremely helpful, lets you re-do exams for a percentage of points back, and sincerely cares about your performance in the class. There are a lot of projects but all are very doable! My easiest acct class the whole semester!

She is a great prof. and makes the requirements crystal clear. Lectures are thorough, lots of note taking and she speaks fast. This course is a TON of work (online homework, 3 quiz, 3 exams, two tax projects). But she gives partial credit extra chances for re-work done correctly. MUST attend all classes to do well.

Awesome instructor, breaks things into nice bites sized pieces and wants her students to learn. I'd recommend her for any accounting class, no matter what your interest level is in regards to accounting.

She's a nice person, but tries to crame too much information in a short period of time. Not enough time to finish exams. She is horrible about posting grades and it takes her forever to post new material which is very frustrating. Overall, she needs some help.

I have to say one of the best professors I have ever had. She gives you plenty of opportunities to succeed. She goes out of her way to help you and her teaching methods are the best. You can easily get an A in the class if you do your work, study and ask for help when needed. Also, class attendance isn't mandatory but it is worth it.

Very helpful and very clear. She was a great teacher overall. This was my second time taking the class and I did much better with her as a professor. Attendance is not mandatory but necessary if you want an A in the class. I would definitely recommend taking her.

I really liked Ms.Best. She was very clear and very friendly. The course is not easy to get an A but not impossible. She makes it comfortable to ask questions and is willing to work with you if you need help.

Must read book for further detail on powerpoint slides. Practice all problems. Professor is always willing to help and curves the exams/projects a good bit. Corp tax return is difficult. I got an A in the course.

This class is a difficult elective! Read the very tedious tax textbook and complete the online homework. She was more effective at teaching Adv Managerial. 3 exams, a HARD corp tax return project, and a tax memo. She is available often for office consultations. Take advantage of these! Good for CPA exam. I got an A.

Very friendly and good at explaining the material, but read the book. The tests can be challenging and long, but she is forgiving if the class struggles. 3 quizzes and 3 exams. No projects! This course is a useful, less difficult accounting elective. I recommend taking her for any course, though.

Professor Best is easy going, friendly, concise, and very helpful. Attendance is not mandatory. Grades come from tests, connect homework, and a simple (fill in the blank) balance sheet project. Lots of extra bonus points here and there! If you are mildly intelligent, Prof. Best makes this class an easy A.

This course is standardized at Kennesaw.  They use the Mcgraw-Hill connect system for assignments.  Accounting isn't easy for most people, so you'll want a good teacher.  Prof. Best was great at explaining material that is pretty awful to deal with.  Getting an A in this course took a lot of work.
